intro: Calvaria boutoniana, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy, herbaceous plants. The plant features a distinctive, fleshy, cup-like structure at the base of its flowers, giving it its common name. Its leaves are deeply lobed and often have a waxy appearance. Calvaria boutoniana typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is known for its striking yellow or orange flowers.
